Fields.DialogueText: Good evening, Cap. My, my, you're up and about. What's going on?
We've got word from the higher-ups. They want us to head to the Gulf of Mexico and deal with some stragglers of a big Morgana fleet that came through.
That's a real hot zone. I thought we were here to defend the East Coast, not be the cleanup crew down south.

Fields.MenuText: What if I told you cheesecake is in order for a job well done?
It's our job to protect, no matter what.
You're unusually fussy, Hull.

Fields.DialogueText: Cap... That's not fair... Bribing me with my favorite dessert like that! Grr... Hm, well. I guess visiting the South won't be so bad.
I agree with that, Cap, but shouldn't they assign a bigger girl to that job? I'm not trying to shirk responsibility, but... oh, there's no helping this. Where are we going first?
... I heard "Goldplater" again yesterday and it got me upset.
It did? Who said it?
I don't know, I just overheard it. But it made me want to go do something a lot better just to show them up. I'm sorry, Cap.
Of all the...! Listen, I'll find who's responsible and I'll talk to them, alright? I promise.
You'd do that, Cap? Thank you... Erm, where are we going first? I'm sorry for derailing you.
We're going to the Corpus Christi dead zone first. Once there, we'll meet with a team, get our directive, and then head along the coast till we reach New Orleans.
Sounds good to me, then. You wanna practice fishing before we head out?
Normally, I'd take you up on that, but we've got some problems.
Problems? Did we accidentally forget to fuel up again? ... I feel full.
No, it's not that; look out the port window.
What the!? Is that Morgana stuck!?
Only one way to find out.
@BATTLE
Hey, Cap, you busy?
No, not at all. What's that you got there? Some kind of paper?
There's an article about the upcoming election. You know who's running?
Roosevelt and that Willkie guy, right?
You've got it. So far, both candidates are really going at it in the advertising department.

Fields.MenuText: Roosevelt looks like he's staring ahead in this picture.
Something about Willkie's smile looks wrong.
Got a favorite?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't think he's served at all, but he's definitely got the "hunter's stare." Wonder what he's going to hunt for? Maybe another victory?
I can't really put my finger on it. That's the kind of smile that you'd find in some kind of old art of a Templar or perhaps a soldier... Well, we'll see how it helps him.
Moot question. We still can't vote.
What!? You're just as much a citizen as any other American.
Yeah, but I'm not 21 yet.
Hmm. Well, may the best man win. That's how it usually works with us.
It's not the "best man," Cap. We're fighting for our lives out here! Whatever it takes to get those Morganas out.
I know we are, Hull. I just wish we could go back to... normal, you know? I'd like to spend some more time with you.
You would now, would you?
I would. Besides, you still owe me that rifle practice from way back. I'm not letting go of that.
Eager to get some more time with me?
Only as much as you can stand me. I know how important your time is to you. So if you don't have enough time after today, we can—
I have plenty of time after today, Cap! I-I mean, I really do.
Hull, are you all right? Your face is kind of red—
Look, Cap! There's a Morgana just off of port! Let's get them good.
@BATTLE
You're kidding.
It's dumb. Believe me, we're trying to change it. There's always '44, though.
Pretty bumpy out today.
It's not supposed to be like this, though. From what I heard, it's going to be clear skies until we get to Christi.
Well, given the air pressure here and some of the clouds I've seen passing overhead... We're going to be having some strong winds.
Damn. I'll have to batten down the hatches, then.
No need, already did it myself. But the storm won't come until later.

Fields.MenuText: Damn... I know you're well-versed in the sea, but damn.
Has anyone ever called you Ishmael?
Sometimes I feel like you're the Captain.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, don't let it get you down, Cap. You're an amazing captain. Without you, I don't think I could've navigated through half of those Morganas.
I'm this ship's captain, though. I should know about the sea and pick up on things to make sure neither the crew nor my Belle gets hurt. I want to protect them and you.
Hahaha! That's the first time I've made somebody get their words like that other than Aylwin. I'll take the compliment! But don't sell yourself short, Cap, you're amazing, too!
That book's really old, Cap. And we're not hunting for whales... But you know what? I'll take the compliment! Though I think you'd be a better Ishmael: you care about us.
Now, see, how can you go discrediting yourself when you've got a will like that!?
I'm sorry, Hull. Maybe it's just the seasickness getting to me, but I'm not feeling as confident.
I'm sure old Roosevelt might feel the same way, and look what he's doing! Everybody's got that moment, Cap. That moment where they feel their weakest. But if we push on, we'll be better tomorrow!
Think Willkie would do that?
He's all for fighting Morgs as long as we don't have to leave our waters. Roosevelt, though... he sees the writing on the wall.
Better to march out and throw a punch than wait for it to come to you.
That's the spirit, Cap! Now, how about we do some target practice? I see some Morgana about.
Good by me! Let's shoot side by side, huh?
Yeah... let's do it together!
@BATTLE
I was expecting us to get more of a greeting than we are right now...
Aw, don't be so sour, Cap. Besides, Texas already has a few Belles. It's not like it's anything new.
I know, but we came here on a mission to clean up the coast. The least they could do is greet us.
Well, there used to be a city here. They left us some supplies at least... Oh, Cap, take a look at this! They gave us a ton of stuff!

Fields.MenuText: There's a lot of stuff in here...
Let's see here... Huh, they also gave us a flag and cigarettes.
Are these... .30-30 rounds?

Fields.DialogueText: Isn't there! Look at all of this... Food, munitions, fuel... Oh boy! There's some stamps in here, too! Can't wait to add these to these to the collection. See, Cap? They welcomed us!
Cigarettes and a flag? I'm finding beer and a lot of cooking untensils. Still, this is incredibly thoughtful, isn't it, Cap? They *did* greet us! ... Just, not normally.
Indeed they are... Doesn't our infantry use .30-06? Odd of them to include something like this here among all this other stuff. But hey, it looks like they greeted us in their own way!
Maybe I'm just too used to it. Oh well, at least they gave us some blessings.
*Rummage* Hm? What is... Hey! Cap! Take a look at this! We've got a letter!
A letter, huh? Hm, it says it's from the Corpus Christi Reconstruction Commission.
"Our dearest welcomes and sincerest thanks for taking up the call of duty. Cleanup isn't always the prettiest job, and we wanted to give you a special welcome."
"In view of Hull's penchant for hunting we thought it a fine idea to give her a proper tool. Therefore, on top of our supplies, we present to you..."
Cap! Is that lever-action?
"We humbly hope you enjoy your time here in the new Corpus Christi. Please avail yourselves of all Texan hospitality, from all of us at the CCRC..." Did they really need to give us this?
Well, call me Aylwin, because this is the *fanciest* welcome I've ever gotten. Woah... Cap, this is a brand new Winchester Model 1894! That's what those rounds were for!
Well, it looks like you've got a new rifle, Hull—wait, why are you handing this to me?
Because I've practiced with mine for a very long time. But, Cap, you need to learn how to use your own. That being said, I'm going to... give you this *ahem!* rifle.
Really? Why, Hull, thank you! I'll be sure to treasure this.
Oh, it's m-my pleasure, Cap. Hey, how about you get some target practice in? I spy a few Morganas out there.
Would you mind showing me how to use this?
S-Sure, Cap! You just put your hands on the back, make sure it's chambered... And... You mind if I hold your hand?
@BATTLE
Well, let's crack her open.
Don't be shy, Cap! What are you finding?
There's a *huff* lot of them out! Come on! Let me show you what a Farragut-class can do!
Eager, aren't you, Hull?
It's like Roosevelt said, Cap! The only thing we have to fear is fear itself! Come on, Cap; let's clear them out.
This'll put some silver on the gold!
Pahahaha! I hope it does! That way those older destroyers can really see what's up!
@BATTLE
Wonderful job, Cap! You really gave it to them with that rifle.

Fields.MenuText: I think I came close to accidentally shooting one of the trees on land...
I could use some work with this thing. Felt like I almost jammed the lever.
Can we practice together later, Hull?

Fields.DialogueText: What's wrong, Cap? Did you feel like you didn't nail enough of those Morganas?
I just would feel better with you helping me aim. You're an eagle when it comes to those pretty eyes of yours.
Nonsense, Cap! You did well. And don't worry, lever burn comes with the territory. Hm? Is that my imagination, or is something crawling out of that hole on land over there?
Pahaha! That's ok, Cap. Sometimes we all hit trees our first time around. Lucky you, though, you're hitting something out there! We just need to... Hm? What's crawling out of that hole on land?
C-Cap! Where do you... Where did that come from!? Don't go saying things like that! A-Anyway, I'd love to—wait, what's that crawling out of that... do you see that?
What is that? Looks like a... rabbit?
Oh dear me! It must've gotten caught up in the fighting! Poor little guy must've lost his... Ergh, Cap! We've got to do something!
Let's go get it, then. We have plenty of experience raising animals, after all.
We really do, don't we?
... Hull, I'm not letting you call me "Farmer Captain."
Aww, come on! I would've let you call me "Farmer Hull."
Already sounding like a couple, aren't we? Well, guess that's just how we... Wait, Hull, why are you blush—
I'm going to go get that r-rabbit!
All right, Cap. Do you have your rifle ready? I spy a few good deer in the distance.
Got it secured, loaded, and ready to roll.
Perfect! All righty, Cap; now, the first thing about rifle safety is this: always keep the muzzle pointed in a safe direction. And it looks like you're abiding by that, so good on you!
If I'm being honest, I talked to a few marines before coming up here. ... They were snickering.
Well, just let them, Cap. They may not like to admit it, but they once didn't know how to use a rifle. Now come over here, lay your rifle on the railing, and bend your knees.
Like this, right? Hm, for some reason this feels kind of nice...
That's because you've got a good handle on your rifle already. Nicely done, Cap! Here's another rule of rifle safety: make sure you're only aiming at what you're going to shoot at.
All right... *Hup!* Butt under shoulder, lean forward...

You're a natural, Cap! Ok... Now, we've got to get a clear shot. Cap, I need you to start breathing deep. When you lull your breath into that deep state, it'll be easier for you to control your gun...
*Inhale* ... *Exhale* ... *Inhale* ... *Exhale* ... *Inhale* ...
Good rhythm, Cap. Now... You know what, here, let me help you with this. You'll need to have a firm grip on your rifle.
W-Woah... Hull, you're...
Hold on, Cap, this'll only take a second... There! Now, keep it there and...

Fields.MenuText: Uh, Hull... You're kind of close...
Wow. *That* is lavender...
Er, Hull... your hands are... really soft.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, how am I going to help you position this rifle correctly if I'm not helping you guide it? ... Oh, oh! W-Whoops... Cap, am I making you uncomfortable? I don't mean to--
I made a new batch today, actually. I think that it's one of my best efforts yet! I-Is it that noticeable? Oh my... Am I too close to you, Cap? Is this okay? I'm sorry.
Well, I do apply cocoa butter every morning just after I take a shower. It's good, and promotes healthy skin. Your hands are... soft too, Cap.
You've got a really tight grip, too, Hull. I'm kind of surprised...
W-Well, a tight grip is necessary for a rifle of this caliber. Otherwise you'll get hurt, and I don't want to see you get hurt, Cap. Listen, I'm not making you uncomfortable, am I? I-I just...
You're all right, Hull, I just wasn't expecting this. Thank you for helping me out. This is... really nice.
Really..? I'm glad. A-Alright. Just adjust your shot, and... Wait, is that a Morgana?
Oh! Damn it! I'm sorry, Hull, I didn't--
No, Cap! That was an *amazing* shot! Come on, let's get them while the going's good!
@BATTLE
*CRACK*
Hm, hm, hm... You're a little jumpy boy, aren't you?
Oh, is that the rabbit, Hull? I'm surprised we managed to save it. How's he holding up?
He's doing quite well, Cap. Originally, he was out of oxygen. Luckily, this makeshift box we've been using has been helipng maintain his temperature.
... Isn't that the box we had the grasshoppers in?
Details, details... Either way, this little fella's still taking it easy. I've been using this little rabbit puppet that I picked up while we were in Corpus.

Fields.MenuText: Huh, he's kind of big for a little guy.
... He's looking at you, Hull, not the puppet.
You're an amazing mom, Hull.

Fields.DialogueText: I was rather surprised myself. He weighs about 10 ounces, which is weird when compared to the usual 3-5 that baby rabbits weigh. Maybe it's good muscle mass? I don't know...
That's another thing, Cap... Baby rabbits are usually born blind and deaf. They don't have acess to either or for three weeks. Yet this little guy's been blinking and reacting to my words...
Aww, c'mon, Cap. Don't make me blush this early! You'll be a great Dad, too, once we swap off. Don't worry, I'll show you the ropes.
I hope this isn't too hard. The little guy looks a bit strong for a baby, don't you think? Maybe he takes after you?
Pfft, Caaaap! Quit it! I may be strong, but... Heh. You're right, though; this little guy is really unusual for his age. Weighs a lot, can see, isn't deaf... what's with it?
You think that the Morganas may have done something to him? Maybe it's some kind of mutation.
I haven't gotten a chance to look at him fully yet, you know? I wager I'll get one chance to do so before the end of the week at this rate. Though that does pose an interesting question.
Like whether Morganas can mess with organic matter?
They can pass through stuff, that's all I know about for now... Oh well, there will be plenty of time on this trip to do it. Speaking of which, where are we headed next, Cap?
We should be arriving in Freeport by nightfall. We'll restock and see about getting rid of a large Morgana cell that's been reported prancing around the area.
Sounds good to me. We can get more practice in that way. After all, I still need to show you how to hunt!
You have no idea how much I'm looking forward to that, Hull.
*Blush* W-Why thanks, Cap. It's all in a day's work! Hm? Oh, looks like we've got company.
Guess I'll show you what I've been working on, huh?
Don't get cocky, Cap. Remember, safety first!
@BATTLE
... Beautiful skyline.
Hello, Hull. Just came back from feeding our little bunny.
Since when did you get so affectionate to the little guy, Cap? I thought you weren't amused by animals on here?
Like I said before, it's taken me some time to get used to it. What are you looking out at?
Oh, just the Texas sky, Cap. You know, this place used to be a wide open expanse of grass and plains as far as the eye could see.

Fields.MenuText: So it wasn't just a dust bowl?
It was? Can't imagine Texas without the desert.
I don't know, I think there's prettier things on this ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Pahahaha! Don't let Texas hear you say that! I can hear her right now: "Don't you dare besmirch my name!" Hehehehe... Well, Cap, no, this place wasn't always like this, y'know?
It's one of the first things that comes to your mind, right? Cowboys, Sam Houston, Davey Crocket, exploring, ranching, and gunfighting—but... this place used to be a lot more free.
Cap...! Hmph! You've been getting a bit cheekier lately. Has that shot on that Morgana gone to your head?
Not really. I just haven't really thought of Texas as anything else than a desert. That and I think there are prettier things I've seen. Your flower collection, for example.
Ohohoh! I've got to show you more of it then. You'll love this fresh one I got while were in Corpus. Texas's very own bluebonnet. But would you believe there used to be a lot of them here?
I think... Didn't this place used to belong to the natives? Well, the whole U.S. did, but specifically, which tribe had this place?
Try "tribes," Cap. There were so many that we still have trouble categorizing all of them! But besides that, Texas used to be beautiful. Wide pastures, animals roaming about—the whole nine yards...
All that changed with the settlers, huh?
Well, yes and no, Cap. Many people came to Texas way before we did, but it's what happened with the frontier that drove a lot away. ... Between you and me, I think curiosity got rid of beauty.
When you look out there, you see buildings, sand, and sometimes patches of grassland. But you can't see the bison anymore, the oases have all dried, and the light pollutes the sky. It's... sad.
The lengths people will go to to survive, not once thinking about the land itself. I understand. Teddy Roosevelt understood that, too. But even with national parks, it'll never be the same.
Which is why when this is all done, Cap, I wanna devote some of my time to bringing the wonder back, y'know?
A noble goal. But given what we've done already, I have no doubt you'll do it. My question is... would you mind if somebody came along?
Why... Cap... Would you really?
I woul—
*ALARM*
Oh, she's going on my mantel for that one...
@BATTLE
Hmm. For how eager they were to interrupt you yesterday, the Morganas are pretty shy today, Hull.
I did blast that last one to kingdom come... Maybe they're scared?
I know I'd be scared if I pissed off a Belle as good as you.
You shouldn't have said that stuff about Texas, then! Calling this place a dust bowl is a one-way ticket to the top of her bad side.
Well, like you, I'd like to see some of those great plains return. Didn't mean it to be insulting, I just--
Pahahaha! It'll be all right, Cap. Trust me on that. ... Hmm, you're certainly right about those Morganas. Where are they?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe Texas got to them first?
Maybe they're using camouflage techniques?
I think the mantelpiece sent a message.

Fields.DialogueText: I doubt it. She's on convoy duty. At least, that's what Dewey's letter suggested. I'm not giving up that easily, though. I know for a fact they're around... I've got that sense.
If they were, I would've spotted them already. To people, Morganas can sometimes seem like ghosts. But Belles know when Morganas are nearby. It's almost like a sixth sense in that... well, sense.
Oh, come now, Cap. The other trophies I've collected from the Morgana haven't stopped them before.
And they have the nerve to call you "Goldplater" when Morganas openly hide from you? That's stupid. They don't know about how you run these waters.
Shucks, Cap. Makes me really happy you're saying that. But make no mistake. There are Morganas around here. Belle senses, you know?
Just another amazing sense to add to the list.
Bet you wish you had that ability, don't you, Cap?
No, actually. I'd rather have a companion who can point out Morganas at my side rather than doing it myself. Two heads are better than one.
A-Ahem! Thanks, Cap... I'm glad you like having me around.
Of course I do! Oh, that reminds me, you want to go fishing after this? A cabin boy told me they were biting good today.
Sounds like a—hold up. ... They're near, Cap.
... There's one over there! All right, everyone, battle stations! The sooner we clear this out, the more time we'll have for fun later!
@BATTLE
Cap! I've got some news...
Well, I hope it's some good news. I just had breakfast and I don't feel like getting indigestion.
I can assure you, Cap, this news is nothing short of astounding.

Fields.MenuText: So... I'm going to get indigestion?
I haven't seen stars in your eyes like that since we found the turkey...
Well, now I'm curious...

Fields.DialogueText: No, Cap, far from it. You'll not only keep your breakfast, but what I'm about to tell you may leave you hungry for more. I almost can't believe it myself...
That's because it's like the turkey, Cap. This could be a monumental discovery that may change the very landscape of American wildlife!
I hope you are, Cap. Because what this is provides a lot more questions than answers. Some of them are questions that I myself don't think I'm ready to answer. This is... This is huge.
Well, don't keep me in suspense! Show me what you know!
Here, Cap. I took these pictures this morning while he was eating a bit. It's been a few weeks since we've got him, but do you notice anything about him that's different?
Aside from darker fur and... oh, he's really big now! You've been feeding him well. He's certainly a big rabbit, but I don't see what's...
Look closer, Cap. Towards his head. Don't you see something sticking out?
... ... ... Wait. Wait, are those spikes? There are these two little spikes sticking out near the top of the ears.
Precisely, Cap. I took that last week, because I thought that he had some sort of tumor or something. But then, when I came down to feed him this morning... Take a look at this!
Great holy...! Those aren't spikes! Those are antlers! What!? Honest to goodness antlers! ... Hull, you're not seriously suggesting that we have a...
I am, Cap. I had some of the eggheads run a few tests on his body to make sure he didn't have anything wrong with him. And those horns weren't grafted either. Cap, we may have discovered something...
Sweet hopping holidays... An *actual* jackalope. Not only a jackalope, but a jackalope *kit* of all things... I... I can't believe it!
Aha! You're getting excited, Cap. But, what should we do?
For now, let's keep it under wraps. We should analyze it first before sending word of it to HQ. It's only a baby, still. Once it gets fully grown, though, I'm not—
... Cap, I want to thank you so much for letting me get this opportunity. I promise I won't let you down.
I-I know you won't, Hull. I want you to at least see this thing a little bit. But when it gets older, we need to—
*CREEEAK*
Damn waves! Maybe I'll lose my breakfast alltogether!
Oh, it's a Morgana! Heck, I'm on it, Cap. Just stay seated and keep breathing! Lay down if you can - it helps stop the head rush of seasickness!
@BATTLE
You're doing pretty good today, Cap. What is that, fish number ten?
Eleven, actually. And it's thanks to you showing me that whole "trembling hook" technique. You save a lot of money without using live bait.
That's the beauty of it. Catching without having to use your own. I like the way you cast, too. It's gotten a lot better.
Why, thank you, Hull. ... Say, how's your research going on our new fearsome friend?
He's doing well. He has a fondness for tree nuts, but won't shy away from meat if he's given some.  He ate a piece of cornbread we got from Galveston...
I hope he doesn't become a giant before we finish this mission... I'm already starting to have second thoughts.
But why, Cap? All he does is sit in his pen, bounce around, ask for pets, and eat. He isn't hurting anyone else...
I'm just worried, is all. The public is already freaking out about Morganas. I can't imagine how they'd feel if a jackalope existed.
America's a big nation now, Cap. You and I both know that. Remember what Roosevelt said about fear?

Fields.MenuText: Nothing but fear itself, but he didn't mean jackalopes.
I understand what Roosevelt said, but this is different.
We'll have to drag our heels for now, but...

Fields.DialogueText: You never know! Maybe Roosevelt could've known about these little critters... Cap, I'm telling you. Things will be all right. I'll do my best to make sure it'll be alright.
This isn't different to me. Both are huge responsibilities to undertake, and I already saved those eagles. Please, Cap. I'm telling you, you can trust me with this.
I understand, Cap. And when the time comes, we'll talk about it. For now, I'm asking you if you could please just let me look at it some more. Please, Cap?
Hull, I have no problem with you looking at it now. But as I said earlier, I don't know what's going to happen when it gets big. We don't even know how it'll act around humans yet!
Cap... I'm going to disagree with your worries. I'm asking you to have some faith in me and what I can accomplish with this little guy. Please.
... All right, Hull, I trust you for now. I'm just worried. I worry about you and the people we're supposed to protect.
... Well, your worries aren't unwarranted.
Why is that?
Because I just hooked a Morgana...
Oh, hell.
@BATTLE
Oh, Cap, I see you're already embracing the local culture. Is that a po' boy you're eating?
With compliments to our caterers. If you want one, you can have one. They're shrimp-flavored.
I already ate a muffin earlier, so I'm all right. But it's nice to see you in high spirits after yesterday.
I wanted to apologize to you about that, Hull. I'm just worried.
And you have a lot of reasons to be, Cap. Which is why I want to thank you again for putting your trust in me. It must be really hard...

Fields.MenuText: "The only thing we have to fear is fear itself."
Hard is just another word for challenging.
It reminded me of how weirded out I was about keeping animals around.

Fields.DialogueText: And you've grown a lot since then, Cap. I'm really proud of you.
Hahaha! That's the spirit, Cap. If you're wondering, our boy is all right. He can hop really high when compared to normal rabbits. Research is going well, otherwise.
Roosevelt! Pahaha! Oh, Cap... Throwing my own words right back at me, but... thank you. Our boy is doing well. He's got a bit of a preference for jumping in weird ways...
And I am of you, Hull. Don't you ever forget that. ... With that said, how's our boy doing?
O-Our boy... Whew, hearing it from you is... A-Ahem! He's doing well. He just has a habit of jumping around every which way. Jackalopes appear to exhibit higher than normal energy.
I'm glad to see he's in good shape. I was beginning to think that the ship couldn't hold him.
You bet, Cap! I've been keeping him on a diet of hay and some good quality grass. Luckily, the marshlands around here have been proving a good spot.
... Wait, Hull, did you say "our boy?"
Well... He is technically ours since we haven't found his mom or other siblings yet. And, I haven't come up with a name. I-Is something wrong, Cap?
Not at all. I just found the name cute. I never thought I'd raise a mythical rabbit with a personification of a ship, yet here we are.
Life certainly throws you curveballs... Luckily, you appear to be knocking them out of the park.
I didn't know you were a fan of baseball, Hull.
I'm not, but I'm about ready to give these Morganas a home run.
I think I am, too.
@BATTLE
I see you. *Cah-chunk* *Bwa-PWOW*
Oooh! That was a really good shot, Cap. You nailed that tree right good.
Thank you very much, Hull. *Ca-chunk* You know, I really like this rifle. It's got a good feel to it.
I should hope it does. Winchester's known for their quality.
Then how come the recruits complain about their rifles so much?
They just don't know how to use it yet. Trust me, Cap. Mastering your weapon is a commitment. You could give someone the strongest rifle known to man, but if they don't know how to shoot it...
Like fish in a barrel. I see what you're saying. I'm fairly confident in this rifle now...
I hope you are, because I think it's time we upped the difficulty. You see that tree over in the pond? Try hitting that.
Alright... Let me just... *C-Chack* What the? It's stuck!
Hold on, Cap. Unload it real quick and lets look at it.
I'm on it...
Hmm.... Hmm... Nothing wrong there... No blemishes here, nothing wrong with the mechanism... Looks like your hands are firm on it, too.

Fields.MenuText: *Heartbeat*
Hull, you're awful close again...
I like this hands-on approach.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't just stand there, Cap. Pay attention! A broken rifle means you'll be as much of a sitting duck as your enemy. Here, give me your hand, I'll show you...
Well, I have to show you how to do this, or else you won't know how to do it yourself. Plus... I... Ahem! Now, just put your hand over here and..
Oh, do you now? Well, get used to it, because I need to show your hands how to move across this thing. Let me just move this over...
Whoa!
*Blush*
Hooh, caught you just in time. Are you all right, Hull?
Captain...
Hull... I—
*ALARM*
W-What the!? Come on, Hull! It's go time!
@BATTLE
Good to see you again, Hull. Thank you for coming.
Cap, about yesterday... I just wanted to thank you for being so quick on the uptake.
You would've done the same for me. I know you would've.
Cap... Listen... I wanted to talk to you about Buck.
Is that what you're calling him? It's a nice name.
I had to reach a conclusion with myself yesterday. And, well... I've decided to agree with you. When this mission is over, I'll let him go.
Hull... Are you sure about that?
Yes, Cap. It took me a bit to think on it... I'm sorry...

Fields.MenuText: Think some more.
You don't have to think.
Hull...

Fields.DialogueText: Cap, are you sure? I'm... really, I'm ok with getting rid of Buck once it's over. You don't have to get in hot water with everyone because I found a jackalope...
Cap, I *have* to think. I'm a Belle, after all! I mean it when I say that I have thought this through. I... really would like to release Buck back after all this is done.
"Hull" what, Cap? I've... made up my mind.
Sorry, Hull. I've been with you too long.
W-What's that supposed to mean!? Cap, I'm serious! I don't want you getting in trouble over something I did!
Hull, listen to me. I know you love Buck. I saw your eyes when you first noticed his horns and heard your voice tremble when you told me about him. I'm going to talk with HQ.
Cap... I...
I mean it, Hull. I'll see what I can do. I really will—Ooogh!
*HUG*
... Nuts.
Morganas?
@BATTLE
Morganas.
Well, it's starting to get spookier about.
It isn't Halloween, is it? I don't have a costume yet.
Neither do I. I was thinking about going as Calamity Jane, if I'm being honest. What about you, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: Hm, maybe a gangster?
Maybe I'd do well as a pirate?
If you're Jane, I'll be Bill.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know how you'd look in a bespoke suit, Cap. ... For some reason, I'm kind of giggling at it. Hehehe... "Bespoke." Something about it sounds silly. Maybe some Morgana need to "bespoke"-en to?
A commander of the high seas, a feared king of their crew, and a harbinger of good fortune. Feared, respected, and sometimes with a ghost ship! ... I wonder if you'd blend in with the Morganas?
Hah! And here I thought I was the only one who knew of those two. Though between you and me, Cap, you need some practice at shooting before you could be Bill.
Care to have a practice session, then?
I'd love to. If we're lucky, we might be able to tag a couple of Morganas. They can be our outlaws!
That reminds me, I think there's supposed to find a big cell of Morganas around here.
Maybe that's why it's so spooky about...
Do you think the Morganas have an aversion to jack-o-lanterns?
I think they would just join the Morganas, Cap.
Would they now? I had no idea squash was so traitorous.
It's not that, Cap. Lighting fires at sea attracts spirits. St. Elmo's Fire may be a scientific phenomenon, but it still attracts spirits.
Should we ban smoking, then?
Pfft... *snrk*
Bahahaha!
Hey... Hull, does laughter also attract spirits?
It's not supposed to. But I'll tell you something, Cap. If these Morganas think they're here for a good time... They're dead wrong.
Heh. "Dead wrong."
@BATTLE
Hadn't really thought about it. Well, unless...
Don't keep me in suspense, Cap!
C'mere, Buck! Uuuuup you go! Sorry about that, Cap. He's been wandering around a bit since he's got his jumping legs.
Given how Buck's developed, I didn't even think he needed jumping legs.
Most rabbits can jump when they're about 10 days old. But Buck here jumps up a bit higher...
*LEAP* *GALLOP* *Snuggle*
Aww, look at that, Cap! He looks like a loaf of bread! That means he's happy...

Fields.MenuText: I'm still trying to process him jumping that high...
If that's happy, what's *excited* like?
... Can I pet him?

Fields.DialogueText: Something tells me he'd be quite popular among drill instructors, Cap. "How high," they ask? Buck can jump as high as a doorway! Look at him... He's gotten so comfortable around us...
I've observed excited. He usually runs around the room in circles while trying to do flips in midair. Sometimes he'll land on his horns and get stuck and I have to help him... And he nuzzles.
Sure, Cap! But mind the horns. They're a little prickly. Try petting his back.
His fur feels like a silk carpet... And he's nuzzling my hand! Hm... You've been doing an amazing job, Hull.
Couldn't have done it without you, Cap. Thanks to you and I, our boy's turned into a lovely little kid.
I've got to say, Hull. I wasn't expecting Buck to be such a... lovemuffin, you know?
He's taken a real big liking to you, Cap. Since I'm awake during the night, I let him sleep with you. ... I hope you don't mind that.
So that's why I've been comfy for the last couple weeks... Pahahahah! If you want to join us, Hull, there's always room for one more.
I-I may take you up on that offer, Cap. I'm glad to see you're happy with Bu—hm? His ears are standing straight up and he's hunched...
I'm going to guess that means he's tense?
Why is he tense? Buck, buddy, are you okay?
Oh... Hey, Hull, look out the window. That's probably why.
A Morgana!? How did I not notice!?
I think we were too focused on Buck. Well, we'll have more time to focus on him later.
@BATTLE
*Whistle* Letting the leaves... Fall on me... Autumn's here... Swinging trees...
You've got a lovely voice, Hull.
C-Cap! H-How long have you been there!?
Maybe I shouldn't have spoken. I wanted to hear more. Are you enjoying the view?
I am, Cap. If there's anything I love about fall, it's the trees turning pretty colors. And I've always wanted to visit Louisiana.
I can see why... Man, it's beautiful out here, even in the bayou.
I hope we see a weeping willow. From what I've read, they drop these little pearl leaves at the end of summer that float about like butterflies...
I'd love to see some if we get the chance... You can see the grass turning flax, water's a bit clearer, and the birds are all flying south--
Shh... Cap, listen. Do you hear that?
What? Hull, what are you--
Shh... just enjoy the scenery.
Hull, this is beautiful...
Isn't it? Sometimes nature doesn't need any extra noise when it can just make its own. And there's nobody I'd... rather share that noise with.

Fields.MenuText: Lavender, lavender, lavender...
*Pull Hull in tightly.*
Letting the leaves... fall on me...

Fields.DialogueText: I decided to put on some extra today... I'm glad you like it so much, Cap. That makes me feel...
C-Cap! I... Hmph... *blush*
Autumn's here... Swinging trees... Loudly sing... To the beat of love... Autumn's here... Darling's home... Travel along... Hand in hand 'till snow...
Hull. I... I like being with you.
I do, too, Cap. I... I really do. A lot more than I... kinda let on.
Hull...
Cap... ... Cap! Hit the deck!
*BOOM*
@BATTLE
Man, Buck, your horns are getting incredibly large...
Cap! I came as fast as I could... I just thought of something.

Fields.MenuText: ... Is there something wrong with him?
I knew it! He's something other than a jackalope.
Those stars in your eyes... I wanna hear what you've got!

Fields.DialogueText: No! No. He's the picture of health, Cap. What I mean has to do with our discovery...
Nope! He's 100% a jackalope. A good guess, though. It has something to do with his existence...
I'm not sure if you're ready for it, Cap. I know this is me we're talking about, but it's my most wild thought yet.
Well, I'm interested. I've been curious to learn more about this little guy, too.
Well, it's something I like to call "One-For-One, One-For-All," Cap. Basically, if Buck here does in fact exist... then that could mean that the other "fearsome critters" are out there, too.
Hm... It is possible. I never thought I'd see ghost ships in my career, much less a jackalope.
But there's something else to it, Cap. Something that strikes me as odd. People have seen jackalopes, but never caught one. And on top of that, from what I've read, there's something else...
The "fearsome critters" and other American myths seem to appear when everything's either exciting or otherwise amok.
And since we're in two wars... Huh, it makes sense. But if that's true, then... What else is out there?
I don't think I can begin to have the slightest idea, Cap. But I want to ask you if you'll be on board with helping me find things if they are!
Heheh... "on board."
Heheh... I didn't catch that when I said it but... *snrk*
Hm? Buck's in that position again... Let's get the jump on those Morganas this time, huh?
Glad you noticed earlier this time!
I learn from the best.
@BATTLE
I already told that one ensign to knock it off with the harmonica.
Appreciate it, but that's not what I meant.
Heya, Cap. You're up kind of early...
New Orleans is really loud and I barely got any sleep last night...
Well, that certainly is a welcome wagon! Though, I understand, Cap. If you want, we can go dock elsewhere?
I was planning on doing that after we stayed here for a day. The mayor's concerned with the Morgana presence around here.
Are they lighting fires?

Fields.MenuText: Don't you start with me... I'm going to laugh again.
Maybe it's the partying?
Or they're partying too hard...

Fields.DialogueText: Aww, Cap... Listen, if you want, you can go take a nap and I'll read to you before you sleep. How about that?
Could be? I heard Texas say it was Mardi Gras, but I think that's in February. I think you may have partied a bit too hard, Cap. You look like you could use a nap.
Laughter is the best medicine, after all! But I don't think you need laughter, Cap. I think what you need is a good ounce of shuteye.
I'd love to, but we've still got to defend against the oncoming Morganas. Trying to slack off now would put everybody in danger.
Just do what I do, Cap. Read, nod off for about an hour, and then get back to it!
Hull, I'm not a Belle. I'm not made out of wishes.
How do you know, Cap? You could have someone's wishes riding on your back.
My only wish right now is to... *yawn* cuddle and... *yawn* sleep...
C-Cap...! Okay, you're way too tired to say those things out loud!
M-Morganas... Hull... you're pretty.
T-Thank you.... Wait! W-What are you blabbering about—oh! There *is* a Morgana out there. Come on, Cap. Let's get moving!
@BATTLE
Autumn's here... Swinging trees...
You know, you really need to teach me that whole song one day. It's rather nice.
Maybe after we get back to base, Cap. Right now, just keep your eyes trained on the goal...
You know, it feels like they should've been here by now.
It's all about the element of surprise, Cap. They won't know that we're aiming right at them...

Fields.MenuText: We're only covered by a few willow trees...
This rifle feels a lot better in my hands now.
They'll know people are here if they keep partying.

Fields.DialogueText: Willow gives us perfect camo, Cap. We're hidden enough that we can pick them off from a distance... I've got a good feeling about this.
I hope it does, Cap. You've more than earned it. With the control you've got over that thing, we'll get that perfect shot in no time...
Well, they'll just be a distraction. In hunting, you take whatever advantage you can get in non-ideal conditions. Don't worry, Cap. we've got this.
Maybe the party's getting to you, Hull. You're in high spirits.
I am with you here, Cap. Who knows? Maybe after this whole thing is done, we can join in the festivities.
Maybe they'll have cheesecake?
I've never had Louisiana cheesecake before... Maybe we should share some together?
Oh, hold on, Hull... I've got something in my sightline.
That's it, Cap... Breathe in... Breathe out... Breathe in... Breathe out..!
*BANG* ... Ah, holy... did you see that, Hull!?
That was a *killer* shot, Cap. But now it's time to see if we can land more of those. Are you ready?
Of course!
@BATTLE
Ah, this is nice, Cap...
It's the first peace and quiet we've gotten in nearly a week.
I see what you were talking about earlier, Cap. There's a big difference when this place isn't hopping.
I hope you're enjoying it as much as I am, 'cause it's not going to last.
How are you so sure, Cap? I think they're all tuckered out.

Fields.MenuText: Because I'm also tuckered out.
They'll party while they sleep.
I saw people preparing for a parade...

Fields.DialogueText: Pahahaha! Oh, Cap... come here. You've been doing a fantastic job and I'm sorry you have to deal with this. It'll all be over soon.
Hm... I wonder if they dream of partying like Dewey dreams about dessert? Hmhmhm... I wouldn't worry too much, Cap. From what I can tell, we're almost done.
Oh, that sounds like fun. Maybe we could go see it together after we're done with patrol?
HQ would throw a fit.
HQ can throw their fit if they want to. My Cap's been working incredibly hard. Even though it'll all be over soon, I worry about you, Cap... I really do.
Thank you, Hull. Well... It's darkest before dawn, I guess. We've almost cleared out the Morgana problem anyhow.
... I know I've said it before, Cap. But I want to let you know again that I'm extremely proud of you. This has to be draining you dry.
As long as you're here with me, I think I could lift the world without having to sleep.
Cap, I appreciate the sentiment, but it looks like you might actually fall over. Promise me you'll nap after this? I'll cover for you.
Hull, I'm a captain. I can't just nap on the job without doing my—
Oh, look who's coming, Cap. Looks like you can rest soon after this.
I hope this Morgana doesn't give us too much trouble...
@BATTLE
Good afternoon, Cap. Glad to see you're well rested now. I came as soon as you called... Did you have some news for me?
As a matter of fact I do, Hull. And it involves Buck.
Ah... I guess that they want me to get rid of him, don't they? I knew this day was coming.
It was, but I don't think it's the day you're expecting.
What do you mean by that, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: I think Buck's going to be just fine.
Well, I did do some talking...
You know what I mean, Hull.

Fields.DialogueText: Cap...! Oh, what did you do? Did Buck get hurt!? Don't leave me like this, Cap. I'm not some worm on a hook, I need answers!
You mean you actually... Cap! You know how I feel about you getting in trouble for stuff I did. Please tell me you didn't get chewed out!?
Throwing my own words back at me, Cap... you sly dog. Come on, tell me what's going on with Buck!?
It's nothing awful, Hull. In fact, I couldn't believe it when I saw the letter myself. But... well, let me show you. Here, take this.
This stamp! It's from the official headquarters of the Department of Agriculture! Look at that golden stalk of corn in the middle... It's... I have to read this!
Cap... I can't believe it. They're letting us keep Buck!
On the condition that he be left in the Department's hands. But, like the eagles, you can visit him whenever you wish.
Cap! I could... I could...! *How* did you manage this!?
I know how much Buck means to you, Hull. I wanted to do my best after you kept doing yours this mission. And... I'd be lying if I said the little fella wasn't growing on me.
Cap! I...!
Hah! This time I was expecting a hug. I'm prepared for anything with you now, Hull.
*ALARM*
Well... almost everything.
@BATTLE
Well, looks like they all came to party...
This has to be the last bit of Morgana we have to clean up here. I didn't think they'd charge right at us.
Maybe they heard you were getting sick of the festivities, Cap?
If the festivities help lure these Morgs to us, I'm happy to join in.
The only thing that's missing is a nice piece of cheesecake. Maybe after we're done...

Fields.MenuText: I'll take you up on that offer.
Does Louisiana even have any cheesecake?
You want to have some tea together, too?

Fields.DialogueText: Hah! That's the first time I've seen you enthusiastic about cheesecake. Maybe the party life's gotten to you, Cap? Still. I'd be happy to share.
I think they have a couple Creole flavors. I've heard from some of the crew that there's this place around North Shore that has delectable deserts. I just know they have good cheesecake...
I didn't know you enjoyed tea, Cap. Are you getting sleepy again?
I'd just like a moment of calm after this, you know?
I kind of do too. Hopefully, the Morganas won't put up much resistance... Oh, well. I think you're going to love the strawberry cheesecake I ordered.
Honestly, with how much you talk about cheesecake, I kind of want to try making some for you myself.
Y-You'd do that for me, Cap? It's not that complicated, but it requires a lot to be a *good* cheesecake, you know?
If it'd make you smile, I'd love to throw my hat into the ring. Do you like graham cracker crust? I think that's what it has on it, right?
Yep! Though sometimes I like when they crush those little chocolate wafers into dust and use that instead... Mhmhm! Delicious...
Well now, that sounds appealing.. I'll mark that down! ... Well, it looks like they're coming again. Are you ready, Hull?
Don't blink, Cap. I'm about to make the shot of the century...
@BATTLE
Buck's so rambunctious today, Cap...

Fields.MenuText: He's done so many flips that my eyes are spinning...
He looks so happy...
You've really outdone yourself, Hull.

Fields.DialogueText: I think he's trying to go for a record. The last time I counted all the flips he did, I stopped at 320... It shows you how far he's really come since we started.
It's all thanks to sticking with him. He went from a bunny who lost his family to this magnificent jackalope. And all it took was just... time and effort.
Cap... This may sound rich coming from me, but I'm so tired.
I don't blame you, Hull. It seems like at the end of this, we're both a couple of old, tired soldiers. And... I don't think I'd have it any other way.
Neither would I, Cap. This whole clean-up... I thought it'd be an enjoyable slog. But now that I see Buck yipping, jumping around, and asking for pats, I just... look at our boy, Cap.
He's our boy. And, I can't wait to see how he gets to grows stronger. Pfft... Listen to me, I sound like some kind of tired parent.
That makes two of us, Cap. I could just sit here, lay down, and fall asleep on your lap.
Pfft, what's with you all of a sudden, Hull? Did you forget to sleep last night?
I did not! I took a nap earlier - it's just that watching Buck makes me tired...
... You're kind of cute when you're tired, you know that?
Aww, cut it out, Cap.
Hold on, I'm going to go pet Buck while I'm at it. C'mere, boy.
I've noticed that his fur is a lot softer than most species of rabbit I've seen. I wonder if that's a thing with jackalopes?
Could be, but you won't catch me complaining about it nudging against my hand any time soon. Isn't that right, Buck?
Hm? Oh, Cap. His ears are sticking straight up again...
... Hey, Hull?
Yeah, Cap?
I want to take you up on that bedtime story offer later.
Pfft... Now I have to read to you *and* Buck.
We've got a lot of stories to tell, Hull. Let's go get those Morganas and write another.
@BATTLE
*whistling*
*whistling*
Oh, you've got a good pitch, Cap.
Thanks, Hull. I'm sorry I snuck up on you. I wanted to check to see how you were doing after Buck left yesterday.
I'm sure he'll be all right, Cap. You trusted me, and I'm going to trust you.
Thank you so much, Hull. I know it's not easy to part with him after all that time, but...
Oh, Cap, don't worry too much about it. He's a happy jackalope. I'm sure the DOA will take good care of him. I've already scheduled a visit for next month.
I can't wait to see him again. This trip wouldn't have been the same without him or you.
I can... say that myself, Cap. I think this mission has been wonderful. Got to see all of the Gulf, found out about a fearsome critter, and most of all... I got to spend more time with you, Cap.

Fields.MenuText: I could very much say the same, Hull. You're wonderful.
I'm never going to forget that willowside song.
*Hug*

Fields.DialogueText: And that makes me just... Oh, I hope I don't have boiler room problems. C-Cap... I'm...
C-Cap! ... I must confess, I've been thinking a lot about that moment, too. Sometimes, I find myself, back there underneath that river, staring at you...
Cap... Oh, you sly... C'mere.
Hull... Listen, I--
Shh... I think I know, Cap. Just... Let's sit here for a while and relax.
Cap...
Yes, Hull?
I know another Morgana's about. And I know we keep saying "after this" and "after that." But... can we continue this?
Of course, Hull.
